data.text:
A flexible, industry-forward online MLS program empowering library professionals

Today’s opportunities and experiences for library professionals are much different than they were just a few years ago. Here at East Carolina University, our Master of Library Science degree has a high-tech and hands-on emphasis. It will teach you the principles, practices, and technologies you need to succeed in a global, multicultural society.

Accredited by the American Library Association, our Master of Library Science program is designed to prepare graduates to utilize new and emerging skills while also gaining the traditional knowledge and values library professionals can use in their profession.

ECU is one of the largest producers of school library media coordinator graduates in North Carolina. Our MLS program is the largest program in the College of Education at ECU, providing students essential resources, internship opportunities, and a wide mentor network. Plus, our Master of Library Science degree is one of the most affordable in the state.

Choose between three concentrations—all 100% online

The university’s MLS program has prepared library professionals since 1939 and provides an online degree using new and emerging technologies. Set your own pace and study a specialty area you are passionate about with our online master’s in library science degree.

ECU’s Master of Library Science program offers three professional concentrations: Academic Library, Public Library, and School Library Media. The online Master of Library Science program is offered with asynchronous courses providing a flexible environment for working professionals.

Balance your career goals and personal commitments while you earn your Master of Library Science degree.

Accreditation for the Master of Library Science program at ECU

The Master of Library Science program at East Carolina University is accredited by the American Library Association Committee on Accreditation, with the status of Conditional accreditation. The next comprehensive review visit is scheduled for Fall 2025. In addition, the MLS program is nationally recognized by the American Association of School Librarians and the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation.

Why earn a Master of Library Science degree at East Carolina University?

The mission of the Master of Library Science program is to prepare library professionals with the knowledge, skills, and values to succeed in a global, multicultural society. As you earn your online Master of Library Science degree, you’ll explore new technology and access industry-forward course content.

Versatile skill set

Build skills to manage library collections in various formats and settings.

Practical experience

Gain real-life learning and experience through internship opportunities.

Community involvement

Instruct individuals and diverse groups to access and utilize library resources and services.

Online MLS program flexibility

Balance your career and family with our Master of Library Science online courses.

Courses you will take in the Master of Library Science online program

Do you want to grow your passion for enriching library user experiences while maintaining a balance with your personal life and career goals? East Carolina University’s MLS program is 100% online with asynchronous courses that help meet the needs of busy parents and working professionals. Plus, you will have an individual faculty advisor helping you every step of the way as you earn your Master of Library Science degree.

ECU’s online Master of Library Science program lets you focus your degree through one of three concentrations for deeper preparation in your preferred area. Graduate feeling empowered to lead in the library profession from coursework that includes:

Foundations of Library and Information Studies

Introduction to Reference

Technology for Library Services

Research Literacy in Library Science

Organization of Information in Libraries

Library Administration and Management

Collection Development

Hear from our Master of Library Science graduates

“The ECU MLS program has prepared me to be a leader in my school as media coordinator, and I am grateful to have learned from some of the very best.”

—Michelle Dooney, MLS ’21

Media Coordinator, Luther “Nick” Jeralds Middle School, Cumberland County, NC

What can you do with your Master of Library Science degree?

East Carolina University offers you an advanced and engaging education in the principles, practices, and technologies of library science. Earning your Master of Library Science degree will give you a competitive edge and help you stand out in the job market.

Graduates of our online MLS program are in high demand

According to our recent employer survey, more than 94% of employers would hire an ECU Master of Library Science graduate in the future. The survey indicates that graduates are prepared to:

Discern professional and legal issues

Conduct research and promote information literacy

Develop and manage collections

Apply standards to collection organization

Administer libraries, use technology, and lead instruction

Where are Master of Library Science graduates working?

Our online MLS program is designed for students seeking employment as librarians and information professionals in schools, universities, community colleges, and public libraries.

The demand for library professionals is increasing. Employment of librarians and library media specialists is projected to grow 9% through 2030, according to the U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics.

Get started on your online master’s in library science degree

Take the next step toward earning your Master of Library Science degree. We have the resources to answer all your questions and help you get started.

Institutional and Professional Licensure Disclosures for Enrolled and Prospective Students

ECU degree programs satisfy the professional licensure and/or certification requirements in North Carolina and prepare students to sit for these exams. However, requirements in other states may be different.
